find

@Get
public org.restlet.representation.Representation find()
The allmighty get method aggregates three distinct features of gaedo : FinderCrudService.findAll(), FinderCrudService.find() and IdBasedService.findById(Object...). It does so by providing a rigourous analysis of the parameters given as input to it. This analysis is split in various steps.
  1. First, the contained type is retrieved (rather easy, since restlet creates the variable for us)
  2. Then search properties are looked up. Their lookup is done the following way: They all start with and are supposed to be map of properties of input bean. As an example, for the User class of gaedo test beans, "login", "password", "id" and "posts" are valid names. However, there are special cases. If any of FilterAggregator are used, they generate associated query expressions.
  3. In the same way, sort parameters are defined by using as prefix, and "Ascending" or "Descending" as value.
  4. Finally, the search operation is given the same way using the parameter

Returns:

find

public Object find(FinderCrudService service,
                   Map<String,Object> filterParams,
                   Map<String,Object> sortParams,
                   Map<String,Object> returnParams)
